alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 3:27AM EDT until May 27 at 3:45AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN FORSYTH COUNTY... At 327 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near King, or 9 miles west of Walnut Cove, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Rural Hall, Donnaha, Pfafftown and Stanleyville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
